revision.comment: /* Films */Typo fixing, replaced: writter → writer using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Rondell Sheridan | image = RondellSheridanSept2008.jpg | caption = Sheridan in September 2008 | birth_name = Rondell Jerome Sheridan | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1958|08|15}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], [[United States|U.S.]] | occupation = Actor, comedian, television director | yearsactive = 1983–present | othername = | website = http://www.rondellsheridan.com/ }} '''Rondell Jerome Sheridan''' (born August 15, 1958) is an American [[actor]], [[comedian]] and [[television director]], best known for his five-year portrayal of [[Victor Baxter]], the goofy-yet-lovable father of a [[psychic]] [[teenager]], in the [[Disney Channel]] [[sitcoms]] ''[[That's So Raven]]'' and ''[[Cory in the House]]''. Sheridan is an alumnus of [[Marquette University]]. ==Filmography== ===Films=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Film ! Role ! Notes |- | 1983 | ''[[The First Turn-On!]]'' | Gang Member Rondell | |- | 1986 | ''[[Deadtime Stories (film)|Deadtime Stories]]'' | Looney Bin Guard | |- | 1999 | ''[[Rites of Passage (1999 film)|Rites of Passage]]'' | Trooper Dixon | |- | 2006 | ''Raise Your Voice'' | Creepy head teacher | |- | rowspan=2|2009 | ''If It Ain't Broke, Break It!'' | Lou, cafe owner | |- | ''Hollywood Housesitter'' | Director | Some scenes
Short |- | rowspan=3|2011 | ''Last Day of School'' | Director | Short |- | ''Wiz's World'' | Director and writer | Short |- | ''Hollywood Halloween'' | Director and writer | Short
Written segments "Let the Sunshine," "Quiet Zoms," and "The Other Side" |- | rowspan=2|2012 | ''Wordplay'' | Director | Short |- | ''What I Did Last Summer'' | Director and editor | Short |- | rowspan=2|2013 | ''Super Impossible Squad'' | Director and writer | Short |- | ''Second Chances'' | Director | Short |- | 2014 | ''Another Assembly'' | Director | |- | 2016 | ''Nowhere Cafe'' | Director | Short |- | 2017 | ''Cattle Call'' | Director | Short |} ===Television=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Goode" |- | 2011 | ''Comedy.TV'' | Himself | |- | rowspan=2|2012 | ''The Jadagrace Show'' | Big Daddy Slim | Season 1 episode 13: "A Tiger's Tale: Part 1" |- | ''Finding the Funny'' | Himself | Documentary |- | 2018 | ''[[Raven's Home]]'' | Victor Baxter | Upcoming episode |} ===Music video=== * "[[Part-Time Lover]]" - [[Stevie Wonder]] (1985) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.rondellsheridan.com/ Official website] * {{IMDb name| id=0792251 | name=Rondell Sheridan}} * {{Twitter|RondellSheridan}} * [http://tommy2.net/content/introndellsheridan.php Audio Interview at Tommy2.Net] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sheridan, Rondell}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male actors from Chicago]] [[Category:African-American comedians]] [[Category:African-American male actors]] [[Category:African-American television directors]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American television directors]] [[Category:Circle in the Square Theatre School alumni]] [[Category:Marquette University alumni]] [[Category:Comedians from Illinois]]
